com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection

Interface IClassInstanceFactory

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IClassInstanceRegistry
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClassInstanceFactory, RepositoryComponentsFactory, RepositoryEnumsFactory, RepositoryFieldsFactory, RepositoryMsgContentsFactory, RepositoryMsgTypeFactory

    public interface IClassInstanceFactory
extends IClassInstanceRegistry
    Factory for creating objects given a source of configuration data and also a registry for storing and accessing those object instances.

    The registry function is built in but an external registry can used instead by setting an IClassInstanceRegistry attribute. This is useful because it is sometimes necessary to have a multiple factories (ie multiple means of creating objects) sharing a single object registry.

    • Field Summary

      This attribute holds the object class.

    • Field Detail

      • CLASS

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • create

        Object create(Object source)
       throws Exception
        Creates an object given the configuration data taken from the given source.

        If an id can be found for the object it is registered with the factory using its class and id (by calling IClassInstanceRegistry.register(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)).

        If this is a single class factory, the object must be an instance of this factory's class (as returned by getFactoryClass).

        Parameters:
        source - Source of configuration data which must contain the objects class and id.
        Returns:
        New created object instance.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the object could not be created of if no class was found in the source or if the class is not allowed in this factory.

      • getRegistry

        IClassInstanceRegistry getRegistry()
        Returns registry object used for storing and accessing object instances.

        If setRegistry(com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection.IClassInstanceRegistry) has not been called to specify an alternate registry, this call will return the default built in registry.

        Returns:
        Registry for storing and accessing object instances. Never null.

      • setRegistry

        void setRegistry(IClassInstanceRegistry registry)
        Use the given registry for storing and accessing object instances.

        If this method is not called, a default built in registry is used.

        Parameters:
        registry - Registry for storing and accessing object instances.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if registry is null.
